templates.template: RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO
templates.name: RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO
templates.description:
Get node metrics from RabbitMQ management plugin provided an HTTP-based API using Zabbix agent.

Для мониторинга RabbitMQ в PTAF PRO
v1.1

Проверяем что rabbitMQ запущен
rabbitmqctl cluster_status

items.name: Get processes summary
items.description: The aggregated data of summary metrics for all processes.

items.name: Disk free alarm
items.description: It checks whether the node has a disk alarm or not.

triggers.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.disk_free_alarm)=1
triggers.name: RabbitMQ node: Free disk space alarm
triggers.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Free disk space alarm (Free space threshold has been reached)
triggers.description: For more details see [Free Disk Space Alarms](https://www.rabbitmq.com/disk-alarms.html).

items.name: Disk free limit
items.description: The free space limit of a disk expressed in bytes.

items.name: Used file descriptors
items.description: The descriptors of the used file.

items.name: Memory alarm
items.description: It checks whether the host has a memory alarm or not.

triggers.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.mem_alarm)=1
triggers.name: RabbitMQ node: Memory alarm
triggers.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Memory alarm (Memory usage threshold has been reached)

items.name: Memory limit
items.description: The memory usage with high watermark properties expressed in bytes.

items.name: Memory used
items.description: The memory usage expressed in bytes.

items.name: RabbitMQ Management plugin version
items.description: The version of the management plugin in use.

items.name: RabbitMQ version
items.description: The version of the RabbitMQ on the node, which processed this request.

triggers.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.overview.rabbitmq_version,#1)<>last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.overview.rabbitmq_version,#2) and length(last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.overview.rabbitmq_version))>0
triggers.name: RabbitMQ node: Version has changed
triggers.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Version has changed (new version: {ITEM.VALUE})
triggers.description: RabbitMQ version has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

items.name: Number of network partitions
items.description: The number of network partitions, which this node "sees".

triggers.expression: min(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.partitions,5m)>0
triggers.name: RabbitMQ node: Number of network partitions is too high
triggers.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Number of network partitions is too high (more than 0 for 5m)

items.name: Is running
items.description: It "sees" whether the node is running or not.

items.name: Runtime run queue
items.description: The average number of Erlang processes waiting to run.

items.name: Sockets available
items.description: The file descriptors available for use as sockets.

items.name: Sockets used
items.description: The number of file descriptors used as sockets.

triggers.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.uptime)<10m
triggers.name: RabbitMQ node: Host has been restarted

items.name: Get nodes
items.description: The HTTP API endpoint that returns metrics of the nodes.

items.name: Get node overview
items.description: The HTTP API endpoint that returns cluster-wide metrics.

items.name: Get queues
items.description: The HTTP API endpoint that returns metrics of the queues metrics.

discovery_rules.name: Health Check 3.8.9- discovery
discovery_rules.description: Specific metrics for the versions: up to and including 3.8.4.

item_prototypes.name: Healthcheck{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description: It checks whether the RabbitMQ application is running; and whether the channels and queues can be listed successfully; and that no alarms are in effect.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/healthchecks/node{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Node healthcheck failed

discovery_rules.name: Health Check 3.8.10+ discovery
discovery_rules.description: Specific metrics for the versions: up to and including 3.8.10.

item_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ Healthcheck: expiration date on the certificates{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description:
It checks the expiration date on the certificates for every listener configured to use the Transport Layer Security (TLS).
It responds with a status code `200 OK` if all the certificates are valid (have not expired).
Otherwise, it responds with a status code `503 Service Unavailable`.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/health/checks/certificate-expiration/1/months{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: There are valid TLS certificates expiring in the next month
trigger_prototypes.description: It checks if there are valid TLS certificates expiring in the next month. This is the default API endpoint path: http://{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/index.html.

item_prototypes.name: Healthcheck: local alarms in effect on this node{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description:
It responds with a status code `200 OK` if there are no local alarms in effect on the target node.
Otherwise, it responds with a status code `503 Service Unavailable`.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/health/checks/local-alarms{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: There are active alarms in the node
trigger_prototypes.description: It checks the active alarms in the nodes via API. This is the default API endpoint path: http://{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/index.html.

item_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ Healthcheck: classic mirrored queues without synchronized mirrors online{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description:
It checks if there are classic mirrored queues without synchronized mirrors online (queues that would potentially lose data if the target node is shut down).
It responds with a status code `200 OK` if there are no such classic mirrored queues.
Otherwise, it responds with a status code `503 Service Unavailable`.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/health/checks/node-is-mirror-sync-critical{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: There are queues that could potentially lose data if this node goes offline.
trigger_prototypes.description: It checks whether there are queues that could potentially lose data if this node goes offline via API. This is the default API endpoint path: http://{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/index.html.

item_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ Healthcheck: queues with minimum online quorum{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description:
It checks if there are quorum queues with minimum online quorum (queues that would lose their quorum and availability if the target node is shut down).
It responds with a status code `200 OK` if there are no such quorum queues.
Otherwise, it responds with a status code `503 Service Unavailable`.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/health/checks/node-is-quorum-critical{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: There are queues that would lose their quorum and availability if this node is shut down.
trigger_prototypes.description: It checks if there are queues that could potentially lose data if this node goes offline via API. This is the default API endpoint path: http://{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/index.html.

item_prototypes.name: Healthcheck: virtual hosts on this node{#SINGLETON}
item_prototypes.description:
It responds with It responds with a status code `200 OK` if all virtual hosts are running on the target node.
Otherwise it responds with a status code `503 Service Unavailable`.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/health/checks/virtual-hosts{#SINGLETON}"])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: There are not running virtual hosts
trigger_prototypes.description: It checks if there are not running virtual hosts via API. This is the default API endpoint path: http://{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/index.html.

discovery_rules.name: RabbitMQ process discovery
discovery_rules.description: The discovery of the RabbitMQ summary processes.

item_prototypes.name: CPU utilization
item_prototypes.description: The percentage of the CPU utilization by a process {#RABBITMQ.NAME}.

item_prototypes.name: Get process data
item_prototypes.description: The summary metrics aggregated by a process {#RABBITMQ.NAME}.

item_prototypes.name: Number of running processes
item_prototypes.description: The number of running processes {#RABBITMQ.NAME}.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])=0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Process is not running

item_prototypes.name: Memory usage, %
item_prototypes.description: The percentage of real memory used by a process {#RABBITMQ.NAME}.

item_prototypes.name: Memory usage (rss)
item_prototypes.description: The summary of resident set size memory used by a process {#RABBITMQ.NAME} expressed in bytes.

item_prototypes.name: Memory usage (vsize)
item_prototypes.description: The summary of virtual memory used by a process {#RABBITMQ.NAME} expressed in bytes.

trigger_prototypes.expression: nodata(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/web.page.get["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}://{$RABBITMQ.API.USER}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PASSWORD}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}:{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}/api/nodes/{$RABBITMQ.CLUSTER.NAME}@{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}?memory=true"],30m)=1 and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Failed to fetch nodes data
trigger_prototypes.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Failed to fetch nodes data (or no data for 30m)
trigger_prototypes.description: Zabbix has not received any data for items for the last 30 minutes.

dependencies.name: RabbitMQ node: Process is not running
dependencies.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])=0

trigger_prototypes.expression: max(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.node.running,5m)=0 and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Node is not running

dependencies.name: RabbitMQ node: Service is down
dependencies.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/net.tcp.service["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}","{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}","{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}"])=0 and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/net.tcp.service["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}","{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}","{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}"])=0 and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Service is down

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/net.tcp.service.perf["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}","{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}","{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}"],5m)>{$RABBITMQ.RESPONSE_TIME.MAX.WARN} and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Service response time is too high
trigger_prototypes.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Service response time is too high (over {$RABBITMQ.RESPONSE_TIME.MAX.WARN}s for 5m)

dependencies.name: RabbitMQ node: Service is down
dependencies.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/net.tcp.service["{$RABBITMQ.API.SCHEME}","{$RABBITMQ.API.HOST}","{$RABBITMQ.API.PORT}"])=0 and last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.proc.num[{#RABBITMQ.NAME}])>0

item.host: RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO
RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO

discovery_rules.name: Queues discovery
discovery_rules.description: The metrics for an individual queue.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Get data
item_prototypes.description: The HTTP API endpoint that returns [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}] queue metrics

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Consumers
item_prototypes.description: The number of consumers.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.queue.consumer_capacity["{#VHOST}/{#QUEUE}"])<0.8
trigger_prototypes.name: PTAF Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Low consumer capacity

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Memory
item_prototypes.description: The bytes of memory consumed by the Erlang process associated with the queue, including stack, heap and internal structures.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages acknowledged per second
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages (per second) delivered to clients and acknowledged.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages acknowledged
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages delivered to clients and acknowledged.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages delivered per second
item_prototypes.description: The count of messages (per second) delivered to consumers in acknowledgement mode.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages delivered
item_prototypes.description: The count of messages delivered to consumers in acknowledgement mode.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Sum of messages delivered per second
item_prototypes.description: The rate of delivery per second. The sum of messages delivered (per second) to consumers: in acknowledgement mode and in no-acknowledgement mode; delivered to consumers in response to `basic.get`: in acknowledgement mode and in no-acknowledgement mode.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Sum of messages delivered
item_prototypes.description: The sum of messages delivered to consumers: in acknowledgement mode and in no-acknowledgement mode; delivered to consumers in response to the `basic.get`: in acknowledgement mode and in no-acknowledgement mode.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages published per second
item_prototypes.description: The rate of published messages per second.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages published
item_prototypes.description: The count of published messages.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages per second
item_prototypes.description: The count of total messages per second in the queue.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages redelivered per second
item_prototypes.description: The rate of messages redelivered per second.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages redelivered
item_prototypes.description: The count of subset of messages in the `deliver_get` queue with the `redelivered` flag set.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages total
item_prototypes.description: The count of total messages in the queue.

trigger_prototypes.expression: min(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.queue.messages["{#VHOST}/{#QUEUE}"],5m)>{$RABBITMQ.MESSAGES.MAX.WARN:"{#QUEUE}"}
trigger_prototypes.name: RabbitMQ node: Too many messages in queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]
trigger_prototypes.event_name: RabbitMQ node: Too many messages in queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}] (over {$RABBITMQ.MESSAGES.MAX.WARN:"{#QUEUE}"} for 5m)

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages ready per second
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages per second ready to be delivered to clients.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages ready
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages ready to be delivered to clients.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages unacknowledged per second
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages per second delivered to clients but not yet acknowledged.

item_prototypes.name: Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Messages unacknowledged
item_prototypes.description: The number of messages delivered to clients but not yet acknowledged.

trigger_prototypes.expression:
last(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.queue.consumer_capacity["{#VHOST}/{#QUEUE}"])<0.8 and 
find(/RabbitMQ node by Zabbix agent for PTAF PRO/rabbitmq.queue.consumers["{#VHOST}/{#QUEUE}"],,"like","ptaf-")=1
trigger_prototypes.name: PTAF Queue [{#VHOST}][{#QUEUE}]: Low consumer capacity

macros.description: The hostname or IP of the API endpoint for the RabbitMQ.
The port of the RabbitMQ API endpoint.
The request scheme, which may be HTTP or HTTPS.
The name of the RabbitMQ cluster.
This macro is used in the discovery of queues. It can be overridden at host level or its linked template level.
This macro is used in the discovery of queues. It can be overridden at host level or its linked template level.
The maximum number of messages in the queue for a trigger expression.
The process name of the RabbitMQ server used in the item key `proc.get`. It could be specified if the correct process name is known.
The process name filter for the RabbitMQ process discovery.
The maximum response time by the RabbitMQ expressed in seconds for a trigger expression.
